data: All the day long the September rain had fallen, and when the night closed in it showed no sign of weariness, but with the same monotonous patter dropped upon the roof, or beat against the windows of the pleasantly lighted room where a young man sat gazing at the glowing grate, and listening apparently to the noise of the storm without.
Rosamond, or, the Youthful Error: A Tale of Riverside; And Other Stories
browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: american literature
